sentences.en: Although newborn animals are immunocompetent, they usually possess no Igs at birth.
sentences.cn: 虽然新生动物有免疫活性, 但它们在出生时,一般不含免疫球蛋白.

sentences.en: As a consequence, newborn baby anteaters are often discarded by their parents.
sentences.cn: 结果, 新生的食蚁兽幼兽往往被它的父母遗弃.

sentences.en: I feel like a newborn baby.
sentences.cn: 我感觉像是个新生的婴儿.

sentences.en: It is not uncommon for parents to put a newborn in a separate room.
sentences.cn: 父母把新生儿放在分隔的房间并非不常见.

sentences.en: Mild jaundice in the newborn is common and often clears without treatment.
sentences.cn: 新生儿有轻微的黄疸较为常见，经常不需要治疗就能自愈。

sentences.en: Newborn babies begin their life with a wail.
sentences.cn: 新生儿痛哭一声便开始了他们的生命.

sentences.en: Newborn calves are not afraid of tigers.
Newborn calves are not afraid of tigers. -- Young people are fearless.
sentences.cn: 初生之 犊 不畏虎.

sentences.en: She was overjoyed when the doctor told her that her newborn baby is healthy and normal.
sentences.cn: 当医生告诉她她的新生儿健康正常时,她万分高兴.

sentences.en: Swaddle your newborn baby so that she feels secure.
sentences.cn: 把你刚出生的孩子用襁褓包裹住，这样她会有安全感。

sentences.en: The aunt stands guard and helps the mother with her newborn calf.
sentences.cn: 这位“阿姨”负责站岗和帮助象妈妈照顾刚出生的小家伙.

sentences.en: The electronic sensor has been adapted to fit on a newborn baby.
sentences.cn: 电子传感器已被改装以适应新生儿。

sentences.en: The newborn calf fears no tigers.
The soft wind breathed their names to the newborn grass.
sentences.cn: 轻风把他们的名字吹向刚刚长出的小草。

trans.tran_cn: （婴儿）新生的，初生的，再生的，复活的
trans.tran_en: A newborn baby or animal is one that has just been born
The newborn are babies or animals who are newborn
